medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with gross hematuria at the age of 60. She had a history of feminizing estrogen therapy starting at 19 years of age and had been treated with estrogen until age 34 after which she took conjugated estrogen tablets intermittently but had a gap between ages 50 and 56 where no estrogen was taken due to acquisition difficulties.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of feminizing hormone therapy and bilateral orchiectomy at age 34. Noted prostate cancer 41 years after initiation of estrogen therapy.
medical_history.family_history: Family history was negative for prostate cancer.
